content: work measures ~17 *if working with two colors switch at about 9 to bind off k 2 move second st to the 1st peg pass the bottom loop over the top loop then place the st back on the 2nd peg rept to end cut yarn and pull through tightly casting on loom k sts & binding off tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=gn2tjxct1_8 continue to pg 4 for finishing machine instructions weave in and out of each needle on machine to cast on with loose gauge crank until work measures ~17 *if working with two colors switch at about 9 to bind off cut a long tail and thread onto a tapestry needle with yarn free from the guide let each st pass as you pick up each st alternating from the inside to the outside and outside to the inside casting on machine k st & binding off tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=pcznve-f-le&list=plv9cndftr5bvqrjz7x1f0hrtv92 kscjf2&index=26 3 justine bent | ig @bentonhandmade | email j​ ustine@bentonhandmade com bent on handmade © 2019 - do not sell or reproduce this pattern or photos the yakima ear warmer ​ v 2 finishing for ​all ​methods step 1 lay flat and smooth your fabric *you should have a long knit tube with open ends on each side of your work step 2 using a tapestry needle on one side of your work whip stitch to close making sure to align your stitches step 3 repeat on opposite side *ensure that your seaming mirrors the opposite side step 4 holding both ends of your ear warmer with the wrong side facing you fold each short side in half corner to corner then fit both sides together like a zigzag step 5 using a tapestry needle sew all four layers of the zig zag together step 6 weave in all ends and turn ear warmer right side out congratulations on completing your very own yakima ear warmer wear and enjoy or gift to a friend but don t forget to use the hashtag #yakimaearwarmer if you choose to sell your finished yakima ear warmers please give due pattern credit to @bentonhandmade 4 justine bent | ig @bentonhandmade | email j​ ustine@bentonhandmade com bent on handmade © 2019 -
